net.pandoragames.util.file

Class ListFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.pandoragames.util.file.ListFile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ObjectListFile

    public class ListFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Reads and writes lists of Strings from and to files. This utility class spares the construction of streams and readers to handle lists stored in files. Respective files are generally UTF-8 encoded. Each string will be read from (written to) a line of its own. However, strings with line break may still be stored as they will be escaped with "\n".

    Whitespace at both ends of the strings will be striped when reading and writing. An empty string will be stored as a single "\" backslash character, while null values will generally be ignored when writing.

    A line that starts with a "#" hash character is considered a comment. Comment lines are ignored when reading, but you may include them in the file by adding them to the list.

    Author:
    Olivier Wehner at 29.03.2008

      • load

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> load()
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the list from the file specified with the constructor. Creates the file if it does not exitst. See class comment for further details.
        Returns:
        list loaded from file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the list could not be written for any reason

      • store

        public void store(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Stores the specified list in the file supplied with the constructor. Creates the file if it does not exist, rewrites it if does exist. Thus this method is equivalent to calling store( list, false ). See class comment for further details.
        Parameters:
        list - to be saved to the file system
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • store

        public void store(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list,
         boolean append)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Stores the specified list in the file supplied with the constructor. Creates the file if it does not exist. See class comment for further details.
        Parameters:
        list - to be saved to the file system
        append - set to true to append to the specified file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
